rrpss

Class RevenueReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • rrpss.RevenueReport

  • public class RevenueReport
extends java.lang.Object
    Prints a restaurant revenue report daily or monthly. This class only consists of Static methods which are capable of printing a revenue report. The revenue report generated can either be a daily report or monthly report, based on the given user input. In order to print a revenue report, the method needs to obtain all order invoices of a Restaurant object through this class method's parameter.
    Author:
    Edwin Candinegara

    • Method Detail

      • printReport

        public static int printReport(java.lang.String period,
              java.util.Vector<OrderInvoice> orderInvoices)
        Traverses through all the order invoice inside the orderInvoices vector to look for OrderInvoice object with the same date or month specified in period. This method differentiates the period, whether it is in the format of DDMMYYYY or MMYYY, by comparing the length of the String period and prints the revenue report accordingly.

        For daily report, each OrderInvoice object will invoke its printInvoice() method and in the end, the total revenue gained on that particular day will also be printed.
        For monthly report, the top and least sales of the month are printed with its date. In addition, the total revenue is also printed. The breakdown of each Order object is not needed.

        In case no OrderInvoice object with the correct date is found, this method returns -1. If period is given as an input with the wrong format, this method returns -2.

        Parameters:
        period - A String indicating the period of the revenue report to be printed
        orderInvoices - A Vector containing all order invoices of a Restaurant object
        Returns:
        1 if the revenue report is successfully printed, -1 if there is no order invoice with the specified date or month, and -2 if the given period String input is in the wrong format.
